contextId.information: This is the answer that Yahweh gives to the priests, but the full answer is only implied. This can be made explicit. AT: "You have polluted me by saying, 'Yahweh's table is contemptible.'" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: By saying that Yahweh's table is contemptible

contextId.information: This expression continues the same metaphor, but leaves out an idea that is implied in the text. This can begin a new sentence. AT: "My covenant with him was also fear, and he feared me" or "In my covenant with him, I required him to fear me, and he did fear me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

The full thought is "Why does he not turn toward the offering or accept it with favor from our hand?" (See [[:en:bible:notes:mal:02:13]]) Some translators may decide to provide this entire thought in their versions. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
